intro: Plagiobothrys pratensis, commonly known as the meadow plagiobothrys, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and stream banks, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are erect and hairy. Plagiobothrys pratensis is an important component of native plant communities and is often found in association with other wildflowers in its habitat.
